title: Performance difference of literal vs "new" allocation is large
body:
by **dahankzter**: 
What does 'go version' print?
go version go1.2.1 linux/amd64

What steps reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.

1. Create a benchmark like http://play.golang.org/p/uWP6r8PdCh
2. Run: go test -bench .

What happened?
There is a noticeably large difference in the performance of the two allocation types.
Especially for the simpler type.

What should have happened instead?
I expected if not equal at least quite similar performance.
